channel.title: Do I need to port foward my VPS?
channel.description: I bought a VPS from Vpsland.com windows 2008 x64 and I downloaded source onto there Java and got my no-ip but when I try to connect it doesn't connect to the server any help?

item.title: Do I need to port foward my VPS?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“ExtremeX-Scape™, post:8, topic:409366”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=510651.msg3705991#msg3705991 date=1313034198]

You just answered the question in your post…
if it’s blocked port forward it.

holy fuck you’re stupid

How do i port forward!??

A VPS IS NOT BEHIND A NAT.
[/quote]

if his port is blocked? then he need to pF right?[/quote]
no, it’s most likely VPSland being smart and blocking known RSPS ports to stop receiving DMCAs.

Perhaps you’ll understand what port forwarding is once you read this: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Port_forwarding

Read full topic
item.source: Do I need to port foward my VPS?

item.title: Do I need to port foward my VPS?
item.dc:creator: @Javerfire Javerfire
item.description:
@Javerfire wrote:

Andrew Ferguson:

No you do not, I would recommend not using VPSland though, they have scammed me twice so far. Kickassvps is better.

his account is true, VPSland is a terrible site, waste of money imo. Also i would recommend for the future, that you keep a firewall (preferably comodo) on your vps at all time to trace/collect ip usage and port information.

Read full topic
